excursion5_desc: A premium package excursion to Cappadocia offers an unforgettable journey to the heart of Turkey. The cost for adults is $85, for children aged 4 to 8 ‚Äî $70, and for children under 3 ‚Äî free. The two-day excursion takes place on Mondays, Thursdays, and Saturdays. Please note that the $85 package does not include water on the bus, lunches on the first and second days, entrance fees to the G√∂reme Open-Air Museum, Turkish night, hot air balloon flight (depending on availability), and jeep ride for balloon panorama. The excursion price includes an entrance ticket to the underground city of Saratli, hotel pick-up and drop-off, air-conditioned bus, insurance, guide services, breakfast and dinner on the first day, hotel accommodation, and breakfast on the second day. On the first day, you'll visit Monk's Valley, Devrent Valley, a pottery workshop, the rock city of Cavusin, and a panoramic tour of Avanos. The second day includes a hot air balloon flight, visits to Uchisar, panoramic stops at Pigeon Valley and Uchiguzel, and a visit to the Oresin Han Caravanserai. Don't forget to bring a camera, water, comfortable shoes, warm clothes, and money for personal expenses. A Cappadocia excursion is a unique opportunity to touch history and enjoy the unparalleled natural beauty.

**Included in the price:**

- Boat cruise to the sunken city of Kekova

**Distance to Demre, Myra, Kekova:**

- From Kemer: 2 hours (98 km)
- From Kiris: 2 hours (95 km)
- From Camyuva: 2 hours (90 km)
- From Tekirova: 1 hour 45 minutes (80 km)

**Attractions to visit during the tour:**

- **St. Nicholas Church in Demre**: built in the 4th century, expanded in the 6th century, damaged by Arab raids in the 7th-8th centuries, restored in the 11th century under Emperor Constantine IX.

- **Rock Tombs of Demre-Myra**: Lycian burial sites from the 4th century BC, previously contained valuable items, closed with stone or bronze doors, but were looted in ancient times.

- **Lycia ‚Äì The Land of the Sun**: Lycians were one of the indigenous peoples of Asia Minor, with history dating back to the 4th century BC. The Lycian League included 23 cities, each with a vote in the parliament.

- **Theater in Demre-Myra**: one of 206 Roman theaters in Turkey, built in the 2nd century AD, accommodated 10,000 spectators.

- **The Sunken City of Kekova**: was part of the mainland but submerged due to an earthquake in antiquity. Swimming and diving are prohibited on the territory of the sunken city.

excursion21_desc:
Pamukkale - UNESCO World Heritage.

**Group size:** 1 to 9 people

**Duration of the tour:** 10 hours

**Distance from Antalya:** 250 km

**Included in the price:** transfer from the hotel within Antalya

**Not included in the price:** meals, entrance tickets

Pamukkale is one of the 18 UNESCO World Heritage sites in Turkey. Pamukkale (which translates from Turkish as 'cotton castle') is a natural site that includes 17 geothermal springs with water temperatures ranging from 35 to 100 degrees, as well as pools with dazzling white terraces formed from travertine (calcium-rich limestone). This place and the ancient city of Hierapolis have been considered a resort for Roman nobility since the 1st century. The first structures of Hierapolis date back to the 2nd millennium BC. However, the city named Hierapolis was built in 190 BC by King Eumenes II of Pergamon. In 133 BC, the city came under Roman rule. In the early 1st century AD, Hierapolis gained fame among the Roman aristocracy as a spa center with the natural springs of Pamukkale. From this moment, the city's prosperity began. Our tour will cover the entire Pamukkale-Hierapolis area with visits to all significant sites (travertines, ancient theater, Temple of Apollo, necropolis). All who wish can also bathe in Cleopatra's baths (ancient pool).

**Additionally:**

+ $100 transfer from Belek

+ $15 visit to Cleopatra's baths

+ $50 visit to the Turkish Maldives ‚Äì Lake Salda
excursion22_desc:
Kaputas Beach and Kas City - individual transfer with waiting. Prices may vary depending on your region. (Check with the manager).

**Price:** from 1 to 9 people

This place you might have seen in almost all promotional brochures about vacations in Turkey. The beach is located under a steep cliff and is famous for its green and turquoise water. You can even see a clear boundary between these colors. After an interesting excursion and a walk around the town of Kas, you will have about 2 hours of free time to enjoy this beautiful beach.

**Main features of Kaputas Beach:**

- **Beach type:** Sand + Fine pebbles
- **Water entry:** Gradual
- **Beach length:** 200 m
- **Beach width:** Wide
- **Crowdedness:** High

**Beach features:**
Like many beaches in Turkey, Kaputas is framed by steep cliffs. To descend to the shore, you need to overcome about two hundred steps. The staircase is not steep, convenient, but still quite long for descent with a stroller. Climbing, especially in the heat, is even more challenging.

**Infrastructure, dining, and safety:**
Popular tourist beaches outside the resorts are sometimes wild, but Kaputas is not one of those. It has all the essentials for a comfortable stay: sunbed and umbrella rentals, several changing cabins, showers, and toilets. Visitors note that sunbed rentals here are more expensive than on many beaches in Turkey. However, you can set up a free mat (if there is space ‚Äì in season the bay is crowded with vacationers). Using changing rooms, toilets, and showers is free for everyone. On such a small stretch of beach, there is only one caf√©. It doesn‚Äôt have a full menu; you can expect coffee, tea, soft drinks, and ice cream. Occasionally, locals sell flatbreads and other street food on the beach. It‚Äôs more reliable to bring your own food and water with you to this beach. There is no regular lifeguard service at Kaputas, which is one reason why the beach does not have a 'Blue Flag'. However, vacationers say that during the high season, lifeguards do patrol the shore.

**Kaputas Beach Infrastructure:**
- Sunbeds
- Umbrellas
- Changing cabins
- Showers
- Toilets
- Caf√©

**What to bring:**
- Comfortable footwear (flip-flops)
- Swimwear
- Sunscreen
- Towel
- Money for personal expenses

excursion25_desc:
Antalya City Tour

**Group Size:** 1 to 9 people

**Duration:** 8 hours

**Distance from Antalya:** 0-50 km

**Included in the price:**
- Transfer from/to the hotel within Antalya
- Visit to Lower D√ºden Waterfall (flowing into the sea)
- Visit to a shopping center
- Visit to the Old Town Kalei√ßi

**Not included in the price:**
- Meals

**Kalei√ßi** is a crossroad of epochs and cultures over the last 2000 years in one place. The history of Antalya began long before the birth of Christ. In 159 BC, Pergamene King Attalos II from the Greek Attalid dynasty founded a new port city at the edge of his kingdom. The city was named after King Attalos. However, just 29 years later, the entire Pergamene kingdom came under Roman control, and the development of the city slowed down for a while. In the 2nd century AD, at the peak of the Roman Empire, Antalya and the entire Antalya region flourished. A walk through the Old Town is a journey through different eras from Ancient Rome, Byzantium, the Ottoman era, to the establishment of modern Turkey. In Kalei√ßi, we will visit all the significant and symbolic places of old Antalya (such as the Yivli Minaret, Hadrian's Gate, Hidirlik Tower, and Byzantine churches), stroll through narrow Eastern streets, visit the old port, and also check out shops with the best Turkish delight in Antalya. Additionally, those interested can extend their tour with a boat trip along the rocky coast of Antalya.

**Additional Options:**

excursion65_desc: Group size: from 1 to 9 people. Duration of the tour: 8 hours. Distance from Antalya: 100-150 km. Included: transfer from a hotel within Antalya, historian guide. Not included: meals, entrance tickets. Just 120 km from Antalya in the town of Demre are St. Nicholas Church (11th century) and the Lycian rock tombs in Myra (5th century BC). St. Nicholas served as the archbishop here, and it is where the legends of him as a protector of children and sailors began. The church where he served, built in the 4th century, has been reconstructed several times and is an important religious site. The Lycian tombs are the largest rock burial complex of ancient Lycia, resembling houses with triangular roofs. The tour also includes a visit to the Greco-Roman theater and a 6th-century Christian chapel. Additionally, you can book a transfer from Belek or Side for $100, a boat trip near Kekova Island for $250, a tour of the ancient city of Phaselis for $30, a visit to the burning mountain Yanartas for $30, or a tour of the ancient city of Rhodiapolis for $30.
excursion66_desc: The cost of the tour to The Land of Legends Theme Park is $100 for adults, $90 for children (4-11 years), and free for children (0-3 years). The tour operates daily. Pickup from hotels by region. Arrival at the park is at 10:30. Free time in the park. Return to hotels between 18:15 and 18:45. Note: Bringing food and drinks into the park is strictly prohibited. The price includes: transfer to and from the hotel, air-conditioned bus, insurance, guide services, entrance ticket to The Land of Legends Theme Park, access to all slides and pools, dolphin show, 5D cinema, surfing. Not included: personal expenses (photos, souvenirs, etc.), drinks during the tour, lunch. What to bring: camera, water, towel, swimsuit, sunscreen, sunglasses, money for personal expenses. Duration of the tour is 10 hours. Available daily.

excursion83_desc: The tour of the Antalya Museum lasts 2 hours and is located 0-50 km from Antalya. Group size: 1 to 12 people. The Antalya Museum covers an area of about 7,000 m¬≤ and includes 13 halls and an outdoor gallery with large exhibits. It is known for its marble sculptures of mythological gods and Roman emperors, as well as unique marble sarcophagi. The museum originated during the Italian occupation of Antalya in 1919, with its treasures remaining in the city. The tour includes transfer from the hotel within Antalya. Meals and entrance fees are not included. Additional options: +60 $ for transfer from the hotel in Side, +50 $ for a tour of the Old Town (Kalei√ßi), +20 $ for a visit to the Lower D√ºden Waterfall, +40 $ for tours to the ancient cities of Perge and Aspendos, +50 $ for a cable car ride up the mountain with a panoramic view of Antalya.
excursion84_desc: The tour of the ancient city of Sagalassos lasts 6 hours and is located 100-150 km from Antalya. Group size: 1 to 12 people. Sagalassos is a unique ancient city with functioning fountains utilizing an antique water supply system. Often referred to as the 'forgotten' or 'lost' city, it is now a beautifully restored ancient site, with 80% of the original materials used in the reconstruction. Visitors can see four fountains, a library with a mosaic floor, a theater, rock tombs, and the agora (central square). The city is free of large tourist crowds, making it an ideal spot for a tranquil walk and enjoying antiquity. The tour includes transfer from the hotel within Antalya. Meals and entrance fees are not included. Additional options: +60 $ for transfer from the hotel in Belek and Side, +25 $ for visiting the 13th-century caravanserai.
excursion85_desc: The tour to the lavender fields in the Isparta province lasts 5 hours and is located 200 km from Antalya. Group size: 1 to 12 people. The lavender fields, situated on the southern slopes of the mountains near Lake Burdur, have recently become a popular tourist destination, although lavender has been cultivated here for quite some time. In two villages, during 3-4 weeks starting from the last week of June, farmers harvest lavender and offer tourists a variety of lavender products: sachets, Turkish delight, honey, oils, soap, perfume. On the tour, you can take beautiful photos and bring home a bouquet of lavender. The tour includes transfer from the hotel within Antalya. Meals are not included. Additional options: +50 $ tour of the ancient city of Sagalassos (capital of Pisidia), +25 $ visit to the Insuyu Cave (the largest in Turkey).
excursion86_desc: The Kia Rio 2023 model is available for rent. The car is equipped with an automatic transmission and runs on gasoline. It has a capacity for 5 people. Insurance is included, but full CASCO does not cover damage to tires and windows. In the event of an accident, you must contact our manager and stay at the scene until the traffic police arrive. Insurance is void if the driver was under the influence of alcohol or drugs during the accident, if the vehicle was handed over to a person without a driver's license or not listed in the rental agreement, or if the client left the scene of the accident. The mileage limit is 270 km per day. The minimum rental period is 24 hours, with the rental time starting from the moment of signing. If the rental period is exceeded by 59 minutes, a full day's rental fee is charged. Required documents include a passport (age at least 23 years) and a driver's license (minimum 5 years of driving experience). The car must be returned with the same amount of fuel as at pickup to avoid additional charges. No refunds are provided for unused fuel.
